answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Andi - when I worked for a city in CA the executive management team was non-union.  Once the city settled with the various union groups, the CM would meet with the executive team (department heads) as a group and confirm what others were getting (or losing) and share what he/she was recommending for the team.  Some discussion, but typically everyone accepted the Manager’s recommendations.  Unfortunately there wasn’t documentation because the executive team wasn’t a recognized “group”, so to speak.
You might post your question with Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM) if someone in Gilbert’s HR is a member. http://www.shrm.org/Pages/default.aspx 
Pam

author: Andi Welsh
text: The Town of Gilbert would like to know what structure and/or process your organization uses to meet with non-unionized, or in lieu of bargaining with, employees to communicate and discuss topics such as employee pay and benefits?  If you have language documented in your rules, or policies describing the process please include that in your response. Your help is greatly appreciated.
title: Employee/Management Communication
